The manufacturer of REGN: COV2 openly acknowledges the use of stem cells in its research, including mouse embryonic stem cells and human blood stem cells.
The: antibody cocktail" given to President Trump was developed using a decades-old cell line derived from embryonic kidney tissues obtained from an aborted human fetus in 1973.
However: no human embryonic stem cells or recently harvested fetal tissues were used in the development of REGN-COV2, according to the manufacturer.
The claim that the drug was: developed using fetal tissue" is in direct conflict with the administration's pro-life platform.
